The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain numerous tiny seeds. Erucaria microcarpa is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America.
